conclusion: To find the power dissipated in the resistor R, consider the forces acting on the conductor rod MN and the power equation.
The conductor rod is sliding uniformly to the right along the rails.
The conductor rod is in contact with the rails and is perpendicular to the rails.
The conductor rod is also in contact with the magnetic field.
The frictional force is given by F_friction = μmg.
The normal force is F_normal = N = mg.
The frictional force is F_friction = F_normal - F_friction = mg - μmg = (1 - μ)mg.
The power dissipated in the resistor R is P = F_friction * v.
The speed of the conductor rod is v = d/Δt, where d is the distance between the rails and Δt is the time taken to slide.
The distance between the rails is d = L/2, where L is the length of the conductor rod.
The time taken to slide is t = L/v.
Substituting values into the power equation: P = (1 - μ)mg * L^2/(2v).
The power dissipated in the resistor R is P = (1 - μ)mg * L^2/(2v).
